Flasche am Flughafen in Dallas. Gold-gelb, kein Scahum, moderate Kohelnsäure. Sanftes Aroma nach Aprikose, Mango, Mandarine. Geschmack: Würzig, Heu, Frucht (Zitrus, Orange, Grapefruit) Saftartiger Antrunk.

Lekki aromat cytrusów, trochę słodu. W smaku lekka słodycz, przyjemna cytrusowa owocowość, może trochę mango, fajnie przebija posmak herbatnika. Goryczka wyważona, aczkolwiek wyraźna. Nie jest landrynkowe. Jak dla mnie piwo ma to czego można oczekiwać od codziennej AIPY. Mi smakowało.

Nice citrus nose. Fairly hoppy. Bit of a bite going down. Nice after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

F: huge, egg-white good retention.
C: gold, clear.
A: malty, bit citrus, caramel fruity, roasted onion, pine resin, paprika, grapefruits, hint of tropical fruits.
T: malty backbone, grapefruits, orange, mango, bit peppery, bit pine, red currants, medium body and carbonation, yes lack some fresh fruity feeling but represents beginning for this American IPA beer style many years ago, enjoyed, 355ml bottle from Carrefour Market in Vertus, France.

Bottled from AH in Mestreech. Color is hazy orange with a think quickly diminishing white head. Hoppy nose. Aroma is dry American hops, fruity and some malts. Flavour dry bitter Finishes with a soap tone and dry hoppy with a subdued bitterness.
Decent IPA beer with the nice fruity flavors some pine lingering in the background and a bold bitter finish. Not bad seems like and average IPA. Nice long good aftertaste.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, cytrusy, zioła, żywica. Kolor ciemnozłoty, klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, lekki lacing. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, słód, cytrusy, zioła, żywica. Goryczka wysoka, wysycenie średnie.

Good IPA. A bit sharp though. Green apple-ish taste with a malty slightly metallic after taste. Very sparkling which I prefer, reminds me of soda water. Not too complex but all together a good IPA experience.
355 ml bottle. It is poured light amber color with a small white foam. Malty grapefruit aroma with a hops. Taste moderate sweet malt, over medium bitter hoppy, notes of grapefruit.

Light ambar colour with a nice white compact head.
Aroma is light malt and pine hoops
Taste is very nice. Well balanced caramel, citric and peach/appricot with a medium hoppy bitterness.
Not a extreme IPA, but really good.

Une robe blonde doré suprlombé d'une fine mousse qui se diffuse rapidement. 
Au nez le houblon se fait sentir 
Bonne carbonation. 
La première bouche présente un groupe fruité et amer pour ensuite ne laisser place qu'à lamer.
Mooi helder, zoet moutig, bloemig, licht tropisch, citrus , iets grapefruit, redelijk harsige bitter.... mooi doordrinkbare IPA

Robe ambré clair, limpide, belle carbonatation, mousse correcte aux nuances rousses. Nez de houblons aromatiques, aux agrumes et fruits exotiques, assez léger. En bouche, grosse amertume en attaque, arômes de fruits exotiques, pas mal de corps, avec du caramel, qui équilibre bien l'amertume. Agréable et bien fait, l'amertume tend à s'atténuer en fin de bouche.
Quite biscuity and malty, a solid old school IPA with medium bitterness. Needs a bit more fruit punch for my taste but a good big brand option if it's there.

Aroma of fruits, pine, malt and some tropical notes as well. Deep Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with average carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Overall an OK IPA.

19/VII/18 - 355ml bottle from Albert Heijn (Ghelamco, Gent), purchased on 8/VI/18, shared @ home - BB: 29/III/19 (so I thought this was less than 3 months old, clearly they put more than 12 months as a best-by date... Probably 18 months or so? Ridiculous! (2018-849) 


Clear orange beer, lots of CO2 chains working their way up in the glass, big creamy solid little irregular yellowish head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, bit of caramel, bit dusty. Where's my hops??? MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very malty, grains, metallic bitterness, very unpleasant, man this is bad, how the hell is this an ipa? (Discovered afterwards it's probably 9 months old...) Aftertaste: alcohol burn, more malts and metallic in the finish, this just taste like a very bitter lager instead of an ipa. Well, if Lagunitas thinks this beer is still good to drink for another 9 months, this is the review they deserve.

Pours somewhat hazy amber colour, topped with medium small white head, not so lasting. Quite resiny nose with some sweet fruity notes, peachy. Moderate bitterness, resiny with lots of gentle fruity character going on. A bit peppery in the finish. Lasting and quite strong aftertaste. Medium body. Good IPA, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle. from Walmart, Florida. Very subtle aroma of light citrus and soft, dew-cooled pine. Clean, refreshing citrus hop flavor that fades quickly and a decent bitterness that finishes clean. This is an overall easily drinkable, slightly hoppy, balanced beer. This is one of the first IPAs I ever had, years ago, at a place in Orlando called Cafe Tu-Tu-Tangos. I loved it, thought I like IPAs because of it, then spent years being confused by a string of poorly cranked out FL IPAs trying to out-bitter the West Coast craft guys. Better breweries of late have made me an IPA fan for sure. Tasting this again now I see why I liked it initially. This is in the ballpark of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, but even more approachable. Not remarkable at first, but so drinkable, and if you have a few, they get better and better.

Flaska på Westpub. Kan inte förstå hur jag inte rate:ad denna tidigare. Guldfärgad med beigevit krona. Mer klassisk västkust:ig IPA med toner av kåda, granskott, citrus, grape och apelsinmarmelad som vägs upp av lite kola och knäckiga toner från malten. Trevlig.

Ipa de 6,2 % abv.
Mon exemplaire était à 5 mois avant sa date.
Couleur doré moyen, à la clarté pure, brillante.
Bulles fines, partout, vives.
Mousse blanche, à fins flocons, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes d'ananas, mandarine, orange.
1ère bouche à l'entame malt/houblon, avec une pointe d'épices.
Arrière-bouche relativement simple, astringente.
2ème qui diminue fortement.
Arrière-bouche à l'amertume verte.
3ème qui devient insignifiante.
Arrière-bouche très mal accordée.
La longueur n'arrange rien.
Jambes très collantes.
Levure faible.
Alcool totalement inefficace.
Finale banale.
CONCLUSION : pas de quoi hanter les mémoires … Sur l'étiquette
le brasseur nous dit " la bière parle, les hommes marmonnent ".
Et ici, précisément sa bière marmonne … Petit couac .. (3/2/2/1/4)
Robe cuivrée, fine mousse blanche. Classique, résine, fruits exotiques, herbacée. Pas mal !
Balanserad arom med karamellmalt, tropik och ananas. Smakmässigt något tunn med dominerande tropiska toner. En  lätt efterhängsen bäska.

From the bottle, this pours a flawless appearance of deep copper orange with a foamy long-lasting head, classic IPA. A little more rustic tarnish to it than others perhaps, all the more appetizing. Aroma is strong on citrus hops, strikingly…
Bottle 35,5cl. Clear golden with a white head. Mixed aroma of malt and hops, not very present. Neutral bitter taste, not lots of flavour, but straight bitter. Medium length.

[Rate 04-08-2018: 6-4-6-4-13 = 3.3]
Drank it now two times from draught in Amsterdams pubs, but with different result. First time having a nice hoppy flavour (and even a late 'burp' delivering me that nice sense... ;-). But second time I didn't really smell very much hoppiness, and didn't taste so much more than a vague bitterness. Nice golden pour with white head; and OK carbo. I average these various experiences in my rate; hope to taste it a third time (or from bottle).
[Re-rate 24-09-2018: 6-4-7-4-13 = 3.4]
Bottle at home pours clear golden with a near-white head, falling down but lasting. Aroma is hoppy but not strong; bit earthy and fruity. Taste moderate bitter with more firm bitter aftertaste. It's a nice IPA.

8/2/18
Had on National IPA day after a shopping excursion over the river to Jersey.

Poured from bottle into a Lagunitas shaker pint. Transparent amber with a moderate head. 

Nose is sticky resinous pine and citrus pith.

Taste is citrus pith and pine with a touch of bready malt to balance. Dry and bitter initially but gives way to a nice malt sweetness. Grapefruit pith comes through big on the finish. No shortage of hops, but nicely balanced.

Palate is a soft, medium-light. Not a ton of carbonation and quite drinkable with malt sweetness and grapefruit bitterness lingering.

Overall, an excellent IPA that's balanced and super drinkable. Strongly hopped and bitter, but a good malty balance. No earth-shattering flavors, but more or less flawless. Another winner from Lagunitas!
Gylden og helt klar. Hvitt lyst skum. Aroma av malt. Smaken er av mild granbar og noe sitrus, samt malt. Tynn konsistens.
Moderat hopfiger, bitter-würziger Beginn. Spritzig, trockene Herbe, grasig. Moderat hopfig bleibend, vollmundig, Heu. Mittellanger Nachhall. Okay. 10/9/9/9//9

Barwa zlota, klarowna. Piana sredniopecherzykowa, szybko redukuje sie do pierscienia. Aromat mocny, tropikalny, slodko- przyprawowy. Smak owocowo- przyprawowo- zywiczny. Spora goryczka, troszke zalega, ale jest przyjemnie.
IPA molto amara, non agrumata, con un gusto deciso e rinfrescante.   Da gustare con calma

Not too impressive aroma, with weak hints of resin and wood. Medium bitter and medium sweet taste, with hints of alcoholic spiciness and a slightly dry mouthfeel. Body is on the lighter side for an IPA of this caliber.

Bottle 0.355L.
Clear orange body with a large, frothy, off-white head, mostly lasting with some lacing; very low density of medium-sized bubbles.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (citrus, grass, pine) and light malty (some caramel) aroma.
Moderate-to-heavy bitter and moderate sweet flavour; long bitter finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
Achetée à Carrefour. Nez assez malté et un peu houblonné mais rien de fou. Bouche sèche amère un peu résineuse plutôt sympa. Pas si mal que ça !

"Heineken annonce aujourd'hui qu'il a acquis toutes les actions restantes de Lagunitas Brewing Company", en juillet 2017. Trouvé chez Leclerc à 1,69 €. Bouteille de 33 cl 8 mois de la LDC. Couleur orange clair, carbonatation moyenne, et petit col. Reste dans les grandes lignes, des IPA, légèrement fruité, légèrement amère, mais manque un peu de fraicheur. Rien d'exceptionnel rien de mauvais.

Cette IPA est honorable lorsque l'on sait que c'est un produit industriel. Mais je n'irai pas plus loin, elle manque en effet de présence en bouche et de longueur pour être une "bonne" IPA". Nous restons dans le moyen de bonne facture donc. Robe blond doré fort sympathique en verre avec une mousse blanc cassée de 3 mm. Le nez est appréciable sur les fruits exotiques, les agrumes et la pêche. A la dégustation, le résineux apparaît pour être bien présent. L'attaque est donc sur le résineux et l'amertume mais manque de consistance. La deuxième bouche se densifie cependant pour présenter des arômes de fruits exotiques et d'agrumes en complément. L'arrière bouche est quant à elle sur une amertume herbacée et saillante. La troisième bouche, la plus amère (IBU de 51,5) se repositionne sur le résineux et précède un final décevant où l'amertume retombe. L'alcool à 6,2 % est honnête par contre.
Plenty of floral aromas but bit of a bland taste. I'd expect a bit more punch from an IPA. Also they seem to have recently reduced the keg ABV from 6.2% to 5.5%.

Some people don't seem to like this anymore following Heineken buying a large stake in the company. Has the beer changed since they bought it? I can't tell any difference. Whilst i don't agree with 'Big Beer' swallowing up craft brewers, it doesn"t make this a bad beer overnight. Still perfectly good ipa. Pours clear amber with small white head. Mild classic ipa aroma, hoppy and bitter as you'd expect from the style. Is it the best ipa I've had, no, but just because it's now owned by a huge multinational doesn't make it suddenly worth disowning as some people suggest. If the quality drops then I'll change my mind, but for now it's still worth a look.

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn Leersum.
Clear dark golden with a white head. Malty citrus aroma with a considerable lack of hops. Bitter taste. High carbonation. Very basic but not unpleasant IPA.
Clear light beer with light beige head.  Aroma is hops,  grape fruit,  malt, fruits.  Sweet,  medium bitterness.  Good fruity IPA.

Barwa złota, piana biała.
Aromat średnio intensywny, tytoń, żywica, cytrusy.
Czyste w smaku, wysoka i zalegająca tytoniowa goryczka.
On tap at Thema. Clear amber colour, small white head, aroma of hops, citruses, taste as well. It's very good, but bit boring.

Golden colored with high white head
Aroma of honey, malt and grass.
Taste: citrus, grass, honey and malt. Well balanced and drinkable.
Bottle from supermarket in France. Golden color, white head. Pretty basic ipa, a bit loke a very hoppy lager... Not for me
Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Gylden. Høyt tett skum. Daler veldig sakte. Pen lacing. God, fyldig fruktaroma. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken balansert. Mørke plommer. Syrlig fruktig ettersmak.
Bottle. Color: Clear orange golden, white head. Aroma: Hop, grapefruit. Taste: Moderate sweet malt, over medium bitter hoppy, notes of grapefruit. Same finish. Medium body, average carbonation. Ok.
Rivers Pub Rouen. Une IPA qui ne révolutionne pas le genre mais qui se boit transquillement. Désaltérante.

33 cl. bottle. Deep gold/clear amber with a cream head. Strong floral hoppy aroma aroma with orange and citrus. Taste is medium bitter with some sweetness. Medium bodied and oily textured with a quite bitter finish. Carbonation is average. Finish is a bit too bitter for my taste. But it is still a solid beer.
Guldig klar vätska med vitt skum. Doft av majs, hö och lite fruktiga toner. Söt len fyllig smak med balanserad beska. God!

Gyllengul färg. Bra skumbildning och stabilitet. Tydlig citruskarraktär. Hög beska utan att bli för hög. Frisk och klar citruston i smak.

Flasa Nobell craft beer.Pena samponova nedrzala dlho.Farba zlatista cira.Vona kvetiny,slabsie citrus,cukrik.Chut svieza citrus,cukrik intenzivnejsie,sladovost,chmel.Telo stredne.Dochut pekna chmelova.
une Ipa legere qui envoie son amertume maitrise en toute fin... a boire tres fraiche quand il fait chaud #fifa2018

Det samma återkommer i smaken.
Pours golden with small head. Aroma is citrus and grapefruit.Taste starts with a little sweet,little bit sour.Aftertaste is orange and grapefruit.Bitterness finish.Light body.

First tasted this beer with my son at a bar in New York. Absolutely delicious considering I expected all the beers over there to taste like Bud. What a surprise! Very yummy beer with a strong citrus flavor, perfect as a thirst quencher. Pity the bottles are so small but then it is quite strong. Delighted to have it available in UK. Well done Heineken for spotting a winner!

Une belle couleur ambrée, mousse disparaissant très vite, notes d'agrumes au nez, une amertume en bouche assez longue sans trop saturer le palais.
Une fraîcheur agréable qui persiste assez longtemps. Une bonne découverte pour Carrefour Saint-Priest.

Light orange with golden hints, perfectly transparent. A quite big and frothy white head shows good retention and nice lacing. Aroma has a light crackery and maybe biscuity base, citric notes (more on the fleshy/jammy side of things though) with grapefruit most noticeable, moderately intense piney and grassy notes. Taste reflects aroma notes, with medium sweet and medium bitterness and a balanced finish that shows a bit more of grass/pine. Possibly rather sweet for the style, expecially in the finish which is less dry than usual. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation, goes down quite easy. Overall an enjoyable 'simplified' ipa, surely flawless. Surely as well not impressive.

Pours clear apricot with a medium beige head, good retention. Aromas of pine resin, grapefruit, caramel, and dough. Medium body, good carbonation, medium dry. Lightly sweet, medium bitter finishes with a lingering resinous finish. A no-nonsense, big, bitter, West coast IPA.

0,355l bottle, courtesy of the distributor, Pours almost clear golden liquid, small white soapy head, Aroma: fade, slightly citrus, orange, Taste: light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light sour, citrus, lemon peel, malty, Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, thick mouthfeel, abrupt citrus malty aftertaste, Overall: not bad, but did not really enjoyed. Boring. Not enough bitter, not enough carbonated, not enough flavorful.

Draft. Clear orange golden with a creamy head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange and apples. Sweet, citrusy, lemon peel, light maltiness, mild bitterness. Light bodied , soft carbonation, easy drinking. Nice.

Ambrato chiaro, limpida, schiuma candida persistente. Aroma agrumato molto gradevole con note resinose. Il gusto conferma gli aromi, con un caramello leggero che bilancia l'amaro spiccato ma non invadente. Carbonazione media che supporta il corpo medio e l'amaro robusto.
Molto gradevole.
Couleur cuivrée; mousse blanche; arômes et goût maltés et fruités; bière très légèrement douce avec finale bien amère

12 oz draft at Beer Bar. Pours clear gold with a bright white head. Citrus and grass aromas with malt underneath. Heavy lacing. Nicely balanced flavors of grapefruit and pine. Malts prevent too much hoppiness and the lingering tart  finish is nice.
(nez > mangue, > pin, ~berga, kumquat, bouche hop, ~poivrée, pin, ~légère, facile, ~savoureuse, 43 hops, 65 malts =))
Bottle flew straight form Seatle to Warsaw (Poland). Aromat little oxidized, caramel, toffee, little citrus. Taste little bitterness, medium sweetnes.

Acheter à Carrefour Wasquehal.
Bouteille de 35,5cl.
Couleur blonde reflet ambre , belle couleur et beaux reflets.
Mousse qui forme un léger col qui ne tient pas.
Au nez : de beau notes agrumes , fruité et céréales.
En bouche : une amertume présente franche mais peut intense .

Agréable et longue.
Une IPA bien fait .
Uma IPA tradicional com amargor bem balanceado e paladar bem agradável. Aroma bem intenso e cor âmbar e espuma branca.

Bouteille 33 cl achetée chez Carrefour market à Lille Fives. Robe dorée. 

Cette bière est d'apparence assez plate, bulles peu visibles et mousse non persistante.
Goût très agréable typique des IPA, équilibrée avec des saveurs houblonnées et une belle amertume, sans être trop présente. Mérite d'être servie bien fraîche. 

Une bière fraîche que j'apprécie particulièrement en terrasse avant un barbecue !

Bouteille de 35,5cl. Couleur dorée limpide, mousse moyenne de tenue moyenne. Des arômes principalement sur l' agrume, c 'est également très végétal avec une grande longueur. Une IPA légère pas trop forte mais goûtue et plutôt pas mal équilibrée. Trouvée à Intermarché.
Bärnstensfärgad klar med vit. Doftar och smakar citrus och lite maltigt. Ok öl som inte sticker ut
Found in bottle in Chicago area. The color is appealing as is the aroma. The taste leaves me underwhelmed though. Very much middle-of-the-road standard for the style.

On tap at The Camden Eye, London. Pours a copper gold with a white head. Aroma: bisuity malt, mild citrus, bread notes. Not aromatic. Taste: biscuity malt, grain, mild citrus, cardboard, straw flavours. Thin to medium bodied. High carbonation. A bit overcarbonated. Moderate bitterness. This is easy to drink but there is not much to it. A very basic flavour balance. Decent but not good.

Just a great beer. Drank numerous times when I was in San Francisco. The sort of beer I love and couldn't find that many places in S.F.  or never in California let alone New Zealand. cereal, grass, resin, basement aromas, leather, smoke,

Na salone piva v starej trznici.

Vona: citrusova
Chut: taktiez citrus horka dochut

On tap at Salon Piva apríl 2018
Quite grassy. But still hop centric. Wonder how it was before Heineken

Tap at Salon piva 4/ 2018. Hopy taste, resin, caramel notes, citrus fruit. Clear golden color, white head. Hopy taste, malty notes, citrus fruit, resin, light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation and hopy bitter finish. Very good.

Van 't vat. Mooi helder oranjekleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, fruit, citrus, agrum, wat exotisch fruit en pompelmoes. Smaak: Hopbitter, fruitig, citrus, agrum, harsachtig, mooi in balans met moutzoet. Medium volmondig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog hopbitter, agrum, wat moutzoet.

Van 't vat in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Helder goudblond-oranje met een witte schuimkraag. G: Tropische fruitbom gecombineerd met citrus. S: Moutzoet met een stevige citrusbitterheid. Tussenin wat harsige en gisttoetsen. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.
Clear yellow/ochre liquid, small head. Strong aroma of hops, with a hint of fruit and yeast. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter, with a hint of fruits.

Bottle at Beehive, Gatwick South Terminal. It pours hazy dark amber with a thick, off-white head. Aroma is a lot of orange (peel, flesh, juice; all in); some iron filings and fragrant daisies. Nice. Taste is dry, with soft carb and quite intense bitterness (but not shocking, mind you). Long lasting, refreshing and nice.
Really smooth robust hoppy IPA without the need to be totally tropical. Medium bodied with a nice bitter finish. Very nice!

Bottiglia 355 ml, schiuma fine bianco sporco persistente, al naso frutta tropicale agrumi, in bocca malto spezie frutta tropicale uva, corpo leggero, carbonazione moderata, lieve acidula, dolce con deciso amaro lungo nel finale. Classica IPA da battaglia. 07.04.18 @ Caffè Clerici Luino

Tap at Belushis, Hammersmith. Hoppy aromas of tropical fruit, possibly subtle biscuit. Cler gold-amber body with white head. Taste is very good with tropical fruit and some maltiness. Great IPA overall.

Bottle at Gothenburg AirPort, bbd 12/1/2019 so should be about 90 days Old. Not the freshest but still not bad for Europe. Citrus, pine, grass, apricot, and a foul smell/taste of old stuff. Meh this is awful and infected.
Great easy drinking IPA. Golden pour. Light flowers, citrus aroma. A little sweet and not super hoppy. Goes down smooth

Pint on tap at the Quadrant, Brighton. Golden amber beer with solid white head. No carbonation but laces well. Nose is earthy, dry, tropical. Slight fizz followed by fruit caramels. Great beer, a pleasure.
Draught@pub in Champagny. Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma tropical fruits, some hops. Taste mainly sweet, hoppy finish.
Bottle 355ml. Pours gold with a light white head. Aroma is pine and flowers. Medium carbonation and medium body. Taste is pine and citrus ending with a weird dry bitter taste.

DWG; Bottle 355ml. Pours moderate, hazy gold with a moderate, frothy, lasting and lacing off-white head. Nose is moderate, honey, citrus, peach and light spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with a somewhat lasting tropic finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Grapefruit aroma. Clear yellow/amber body with thick white head. Nice palate. Flavour is a soft IPA, nice, not too much pine.
La probé por primera vez hace un par de años en botella en USA, hoy la he probado de nuevo de barril en Barcelona. Buen aroma y buen final. Una muy buena IPA

Lighter IPA with a bitter finish, and very easy going down. Medium head, and not many notes picked up. Still very good.

Probada en botella en El Lúpulo Feroz de Oviedo 10/2/2018. La última vez que la probé estaba bastante rica, sin destacar por encima de otras IPAs americanas. Pero esta vez ha sido una decepción: apenas aroma, sabor rozando la oxidación. Amargor en una cerveza con poco cuerpo. Es posible que la cerveza tenga ya unos meses y por eso ya no esté al 100%

Bottle. Pale color, med white head.

Yeasty aroma. Honey-colour pour, billowy pale head. Bitter bread taste, more bitter finish.
Great aroma and nice IPA, bottle structure is little weird. Beer taste great and definitely one of my favorites.

Pours a clear, deep golden amber coloration with a medium, fizzy head. Smells of caramel malt, grapefruit and orange rind, with a hint of pine. Taste is malt-forward, with pretty little hop character and a certain grainy/earthy quality. Caramel, biscuity malts most noticeable, with mild hoppy notes of grapefruit, orange rind and pine. Crisp and dry, with a medium bitterness in the aftertaste. This the archetype of what I like to refer to as an "old school IPA". Malt-forward, mildly hopped, with certain grainy/earthy notes and dry, piney bitterness. Nicely balanced, but not my cup of tea, as I really prefer stronger hopped brews.

It pours a somewhat hazy gold with a large white long lasting head. It has the aroma of tropical fruit, mango, tangerine, pine & grapefruit. It has a nice bitterness to it and tastes of pine, grapefruit, resin, citrus & flowers. This is a classic west coast IPA. I greatly enjoyed drinking this and highly recommend it.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch L2280 (BBF 30.03.2018) AROMA: medium-low hop notes with a pine and fruity character. low malt background with a toffee character. APPEARANCE: deep gold color and clear. medium ivory head, moussy, with good retention. TASTE: medium-low piny hop notes with a soft lightly toffee malt background. medium to medium-high bitterness with a dry and bitter finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: an american IPA where the hops are not very intense (maybe the sample isnt very fresh).
citrus, herbs, golden, orange, red, brown, clear, frothy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, light body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

The definition of a west coast IPA, Lagunitas IPA features crisp citrus and pine hop character layered atop a light pale malt backbone. The hops are juicy and in your fade. A nice wash of carbonation brings the hop spice to a crescendo in the finish. Pours pretty light copper with a healthy white head, and ample lacing.

Don’t let the simple label fool you. This is a great little beer. Aroma is a little floral and fruity and the taste is just over the reserved line. A light pour with a clean taste that allows for several follow-ups. 
The flavour is well balanced between hops and malt and  stays consistent for about 2/3 the glass and then it’s a sweeter finish. 
Easy to enjoy!

12-ounce bottle pours clear gold with a creamy off-white head; lots of lacing. Aroma: citrus and tropical fruits, honey, pine. Flavor: grapefruit, orange, pineapple, mango, pine. Mouthfeel: medium-bodied, dry and crisp.

From January 2011. 

I bought a six pack and brought it home before I looked at the bottles...loaded with floaties. Checking on the Julian date, I see it was bottled June 10. Oh well.

It has a nice honey gold colour with a minimal head of foam and very little lacing. I'm keeping the floaties in the bottle...

Big lemon citrus notes with some biscuit notes in the smell. 

Ditto for the taste only here it doesn't show much balance and the hop flavour seems harsh to me. It's rather thin bodied, lowish with the carbonation, and isn't all that drinkable.

As is, it doesn't impress me but if I come across fresher samples, I'll give it another go and see if a change in my review is needed.

Pours clear golden yellow with two fingers thick white head.
Malty sweet and slightly citrus aroma, balanced bittersweet taste, nice mouthfeel.
Simple and effective IPA.

Bottle 355ml. Nice light amber colour. Candy smell with some herbal aroma as well and malts. Sweet taste, bitternes almost zero, medium body. Hoops, herbs, still a bit of candy taste. Overal, interesting beer.
0.33l bottle. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma: candy, pineapple, caramel. Taste: candy, caramel, toffee, grapefruit. Medium body, moderate carbonation, high bitterness.
Golden color, small white head. Aromas of citrus, malt, soap, pine and slight syrup. Medium bitter taste with grass, pine, lemon peel and hops.
Nice pale looking IPA. Flowery and hoppy and quite grassy, clean pint of beer and slips down easily.
Une bière sèche, amère avec des saveurs d'agrumes, de pamplemousse et légèrement maltée. Une bonne IPA.

Léger col de mousse blanche, bière de couleur cuivre, bulles fines. Bel arôme de fruits exotiques. Le fruité est moins expressif en bouche, mais nous retrouvons ces fruits exotiques, peut être des litchis, sur une belle amertume. Une IPA US industrielle mais de belle facture pour nous européen. Je la recommande pour habituer son palais aux saveurs houblonnées sans amertume gigantesque. 355 ml chez Monoprix
light citrus/pine aromas. gold and clear in color with great head. taste is balanced with nice citrus, pine, faint resin, and light crystal malt notes

33cl bottle at Circus, Rimini, Italy. Pours transparent intense gold with irregular white foam, very fine. Aroma is citrus, with a little caramel, some mandarin when just opened. Body is average with good carbonation. Taste is bitter, with limited sweetness. Finish is average.
bottle. aroma: wet malt, caramel, fruity esters,  light hops, light solvent. medium body, medium unpleasant bitterness. nothing special

On tap at Bryan’s American Grille.  Virtually nothing on the nose. Poured a nice golden color, not head retention though.  Taste is standard west coast IPA, keg might be a bit older. Easy drinking, good bitterness. Light beer mouthfeel isn’t great.

Appearance- clear and amber, a clingy 1-finger white head. Aroma- fruity hops, lemon, orange, pineapple, tropical fruit hints. Taste- lots of bitter hops, hop resin, orange peel, clingy bitterness, juicy fruit, pithy fruit, fluffy malt in the background. Lingering bitter finish.

This is a great go to IPA. Perfectly balanced with a nice hoppy, and floral character but not over powering. It's a great beer to pair with your favorite pizza or just enjoy by itself on a nice hot day.

Tame aroma of hops, mainly citrus and grass. Taste is a bit better though, with a healthy amount of bitterness and crispness. Bitter herbs, grapefruit, pine. A bit watery, lacks potency. It's decent and pretty generic.

From the tap (6.2%), free sample from the owner, The Admiral, Glasgow on 5 Dec 2017: floral, pine aroma, golden with a large foamy cream head, grassy, fruity, sweet, gentle fizz, hides the abv very well.

Dec 17 : 4.0 Belle couleur cuivrée, pas de mousse. L'ipa est bien aromatique, amertume bien présente. Bonne ipa!
Mai 19 : 3.6 Regoutée suite à une promo chez Carrefour. Rien d'extra dans cette ipa, commune
Juillet 21 : 3.8 Résineuse, amère, sèche, ipa dans les codes, bien pour une bière de supermarché.
Pours amber colour with fruity hoppy aroma . Tastes good with medium body and good carbonation
fresh, light fruity aroma with a bit of dankiness. well balanced, ligh and refreshing, extremely drinkable!

Golden with a white head - Fruity hop aroma with some herbal notes as well - Malt body to support a good hop flavour that has some fruity notes and a herbal flavourn in the back - The herbal hops goes into the finish that goes dry - This was good
10-09-17 // draft at The Euston Tap, London. Classic IPA. Golden coloured, light hoppy nose. Sweet mlaty Backbone with a piney, citrus hop character. Medium bitter.

Questa IPA si presenta con una bella schiuma e un ottimo aroma di agrumi, pompelmo in particolare. Il gusto ricorda l'aroma con l'aggiunta dell'amaro dei luppoli, molto ben bilanciato. Carbonatura decisamente azzecata che accompagna il retrogusto amaro, molto piacevole.

It has a nice combination of citrus malt and spruce hops.  The appearance was a red/golden color that leads to a white head.  Has a sweet flavor with a light body, lively carbonation and a bitter finish.
Keg at the Royal Standard, Wandsworth. Vague hoppy aroma. Hazy amber. Frothy but blotchy white head. Light bitter. Some sourness around the edges. Light. Thin. Fizzy. Average for the style.

Appearance: dark golden color, with big foamy head
Aroma: malty, caramel, cereal.  
Taste: malty, hops, orange, caramel, and ends a bit bitter.

A hop head's dream, very hoppy, more bitter than fruity but some citrus in there too. If there one downside to this is the carbonation, so fizzy. And it's so tasty that you drink it quick. So you get tipsy quick, 6.2% so no wonder.and you're burping too. Drink it with a meal, and then move onto the session beers.

From a bottle. Pours a clear, dark yellow color, with a big, foamy, beige head. Sharp, piney and citrusy aroma, with some honey, minerals, and damp grass. Very bitter, and not much malt backbone. Light to medium body, with a sharp and slick palate. This is a pretty nice, aromatic IPA.
Draft in Ma’dam restaurant in the A’dam Tower.  Really delicious IPA: would defenity recommand this one

Apariencia : ámbar translúcido (aprox.

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre "Saveurs bières".
Température de début 6 à 7°.
Robe orangée surmontée d'une fine mousse blanche peu persistante; carbonatation moyenne.
Nez subtil sur des arômes de houblons et d'agrumes avec une note boisée.
Le goût est remarquablement équilibré avec une belle amertume: les houblons sont de grande qualité et on apprécie les saveurs fruitées qui ont du caractère.
Le palais est long, frais et sans aucune lourdeur.
Une très bonne IPA à boire en écoutant "Going to California" de Led Zeppelin!!
